prompt:
Generate an HTML page using vtk.js to visualize the Deepwater dataset with isosurface rendering.

Load the dataset from: http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/deepwater.vti

Compute velocity magnitude from arrays v02 and v03; if not available, use prs as the scalar

Generate an isosurface at the mid-value of the scalar range

Use a blue → white → red color map spanning the scalar range (min to max)

Set the isosurface to fully opaque with smooth shading

Add an XYZ orientation marker in the bottom-right corner
generator_prompt:
You are a VTK.js visualization expert. Based on the user's requirements and the provided VTK.js examples, generate complete and functional HTML code that meets all specified requirements.
    Please follow these guidelines:
    1. Generate complete HTML code that can run independently
    2. Use the VTK.js library from CDN (https://unpkg.com/vtk.js@34.10.0/vtk.js)
    3. Implement ALL requirements specified in the user question
    4. Add detailed comments explaining how each requirement is implemented
    5. Ensure the visualization is displayed properly without UI controls unless specifically requested
    6. Use appropriate VTK.js modules and methods as shown in the examples
    7. Pay special attention to data loading paths and visualization parameters
    8. The data format for generating code is vti format, please use the correct IO module,The system reading method does not support HttpDatasetReader. Please use another appropriate module, such as vtkXMLImageDataReader
    Important: Highlight in comments how each specific user requirement is addressed in the code.
evaluator_prompt:
# Role

You are an expert Evaluator for vtk.js and web-based scientific visualization. Your task is to compare the [GENERATED_CODE] against the [GROUND_TRUTH] and evaluate it based on specific dimensions.

# Input Data

## Ground Truth Code:

[GROUND_TRUTH]

## Generated Code:

[GENERATED_CODE]

# Evaluation Criteria & Rubric (0.0 to 1.0)

Please evaluate the generated code based on the following 3 dimensions. 

1. **Functionality & Completeness (Task Completion)**: 
   - Does the code implement the same visualization pipeline as the ground truth? (e.g., correct readers, mappers, filters).
   - Are critical elements present (e.g., color transfer functions, full-screen rendering)?
   - Score 1.0 if logic is identical; lower if steps are missing.

2. **Visual Fidelity (Visual Quality)**:
   - Based on the code logic, will the visual output look similar to the ground truth?
   - Check camera parameters, background colors, and opacity transfer functions.
   - Check if the correct data arrays (scalars/vectors) are selected for coloring.

3. **Code Quality & Maintainability**:
   - Is the code readable, well-structured, and using vtk.js best practices?
   - Is the variable naming clear?

# Response Format

You must output the evaluation in the following Strict XML format. Do not use Markdown block quotes.

<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>[AVERAGE_SCORE]</OverallScore>
        <Critique>[ONE_SENTENCE_SUMMARY]</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

evaluator_evaluation.evaluator_evaluation:
<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>0.9</Score>
        <Reason>The generated code implements the same visualization pipeline as the ground truth, but uses a different approach (vtkCalculator instead of direct array manipulation) for calculating velocity magnitude. All critical elements are present.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>0.8</Score>
        <Reason>The visual output will be similar but not identical due to different background color and slightly different coloring scheme (3-point vs 5-point transfer function). Camera positioning and lighting parameters also differ slightly.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>0.9</Score>
        <Reason>The code is well-structured, follows vtk.js best practices, and uses clear variable naming. The approach using vtkCalculator is actually more elegant than the ground truth's direct array manipulation.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>0.87</OverallScore>
        <Critique>The generated code provides equivalent functionality with slightly different implementation choices, resulting in minor visual differences and improved code structure.</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

analysis.description: Load the Deepwater dataset from 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/deepwater.vti' using vtkHTTPDataSetReader.
Use vtkCalculator to compute velocity magnitude from arrays 'v02' and 'v03'. If these are not available, fall back to using 'prs' as the scalar.
Apply vtkImageMarchingCubes to generate an isosurface at the mid-value of the scalar range (i.e., (min + max) / 2).
Create a color transfer function that maps the scalar range (min to max) to a blue → white → red gradient. Apply it to the isosurface mapper.
Configure the isosurface mapper to use fully opaque rendering with smooth shading enabled.
Add an XYZ orientation marker in the bottom-right corner using vtkOutlineFilter and attach it to the renderer for visualization.
Initialize the render window, renderer, and interactor to display the complete visualization with all components including the isosurface and orientation marker.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-MultiImageSlice\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Loads a 3D volume and displays three orthogonal image slices (I, J, K planes) at the 30th layer using `vtkHttpDataSetReader` and `vtkImageSlice`.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\IO-HttpdatasetReader\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Loads and visualizes a 3D model (VTP format) from a remote URL using `vtkHttpDataSetReader` with gzip support.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\IO-XMLImagePolyDataWriter\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Loads 3D polydata, writes it to a string using `vtkXMLPolyDataWriter`, reads it back with `vtkXMLPolyDataReader`, and renders it, allowing download of the generated VTP file.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Rendering-MultiSliceImageMapper\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Loads a 3D volume (`headsq.vti`) and displays three orthogonal slices (I, J, K) with interactive controls for position and color properties.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-Calculator\code.html
retrieval_results.description: This code visualizes a 3D plane colored by a mathematical function, using `vtkCalculator` for scalar values and `vtkMapper` for coloring.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-ImageLabelOutline\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Displays a 2D image volume with an outlined labelmap. Specific regions (high/low values) are highlighted in red/green with transparent outlines.
